page.title: 08DAIRY FARMING BOREHAM
page.content: Bulls Lodge Dairy Farm is part of a group, that covers much of the area.There are 500 cattle Fresian X Holstein. The land consists mostly of leys,but some wheat is grown for a change. There is a large enclosed area,with pens and a circular milking parlour.When the complex was built in 1975 it was the largest of its kind in Europe. The cows are brought in for part of the day as soon as they have calved,and for the full day in August, because by then the grass is less nourishing.They are then fed on unlimited silage, and cattle cake. They also like to drink the residue from the silage, which contains nutrients. The average useful lifetime for a cow is 7 years.The cows have identification tags.
